definition: to resemble/to be like/to look as if/such as/appearance/image/portrait/image under a mapping (math.)
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]

sentences.english: You know that angel in the gate custody fight is the most outrageous of?
sentences.chinese: 你們可知道，監護天使在城門口打架是最不像話的？

sentences.english: What a shame to deceive you in that way.
sentences.chinese: 那樣欺騙你太不像話了。

sentences.english: It's scandalous that you still haven't been paid.
sentences.chinese: 你還沒有拿到工資這太不像話了。

sentences.english: It's a crying shame to waste all that food.
sentences.chinese: 浪費那麼多食物，真是太不像話了。

sentences.english: It is a shame to treat the little child like that.
sentences.chinese: 這樣對待一個小孩太不像話了。

sentences.english: It would be unreasonable for you to pay out of your own pockets.
sentences.chinese: 要你們自己掏錢就不像話了。

sentences.english: It's disgraceful the way he treats his mother.
sentences.chinese: 他那樣對待他母親太不像話了。

sentences.english: He says he loves her, he sent her roses, everything was beautiful too.
sentences.chinese: 他說他愛她，他送她玫瑰花，一切都美得不像話。

sentences.english: There followed an undignified slamming of doors.
sentences.chinese: 隨後傳來了很不像話的摔門聲。

sentences.english: You can't talk to me like that. You are so disrespectful.
sentences.chinese: 你怎敢這樣說話，太不像話了。

sentences.english: It's very awkward of you not to play for the team tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 你明天不爲本隊參加比賽可太不像話了。
